summary: Johanna Lynn Smith was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCA). The documents available are payroll and certification reports from April, August, and December of 1978. These documents list her name, salary, and employment dates within the SCA. The documents do not provide specific details about her role or responsibilities within the committee, but they confirm her employment during the period the committee was actively investigating the JFK assassination.
significance: Johanna Lynn Smith's significance lies in her employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCA). As an employee, she was involved in the investigation of the JFK assassination, though the specific nature and impact of her role are not detailed in the provided documents.
